content.question:
Water is pumped into an underground tank at a constant rate of 8 gallons per minute. Water leaks out of the tank at the rate of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38A5@</annotation> </semantics> </math> gallons per minute, for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>120</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D42@</annotation> </semantics> </math> minutes. At time t = 0, the tank contains 30 gallons of water.

(a) How many gallons of water leak out of the tank from time t = 0 to t = 3 minutes?

frqParts.text:
Water is pumped into an underground tank at a constant rate of 8 gallons per minute. Water leaks out of the tank at the rate of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38A5@</annotation> </semantics> </math> gallons per minute, for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>120</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D42@</annotation> </semantics> </math> minutes. At time t = 0, the tank contains 30 gallons of water.

(a) How many gallons of water leak out of the tank from time t = 0 to t = 3 minutes?
(b) How many gallons of water are in the tank at time t = 3 minutes?
(c) Write an expression for A(t), the total number of gallons of water in the tank at time t.
(d) At what time t, for 0 ≤ t ≤ 120, is the amount of water in the tank a maximum? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
